column2:
character
  1. The first letter of the Lushootseed alphabet, pronounced as a glottal stop
  2. alternative of ʔ letter

character
  1. The second letter of the Lushootseed alphabet, pronounced as an open back unrounded vowel.

character
  1. The third letter of the Lushootseed alphabet, pronounced as a voiced bilabial stop.

verb
  1. to happen again; to do so in the same manner again

verb
  1. take it again; repeat it (additive & causative form of ʔux̌ʷ)

character
  1. The fourth letter of the Lushootseed alphabet, pronounced as a voiced bilabial implosive; a rare, non-initial sound.

character
  1. The fifth letter of the Lushootseed alphabet, pronounced as a voiceless alveolar affricate.

noun
  1. root word & vocative form of scapaʔ (“grandfather; brother or male cousin of grandparent”)

noun
  1. grandchild's spouse, grandchild-in-law (affine relative of second descending generation)

character
  1. The sixth letter of the Lushootseed alphabet, pronounced as a voiceless ejective alveolar affricate.

character
  1. The ninth letter of the Lushootseed alphabet, pronounced as a voiced alveolar stop.

name
  1. the Klallam peoples or a member of those peoples

name
  1. Nuwhaha; a member of the Nuwhaha people

adj

character
  1. The tenth letter of the Lushootseed alphabet, pronounced as a voiced alveolar affricate.

name
  1. the original Coast Salish settlements surrounding the Elliott Bay area, now the City of Seattle; sometimes used to refer to Seattle's Pioneer Square.

character
  1. The twelfth letter of the Lushootseed alphabet, pronounced as a voiced velar stop.

character
  1. The thirteenth letter of the Lushootseed alphabet, pronounced as a voiced labialized velar stop.

character
  1. The fourteenth letter of the Lushootseed alphabet, pronounced as a voiceless glottal fricative.

  1. then, next; for; because (sentential adverb; used especially to introduce sentences in long narratives, often in combination with other sentential adverbs)

verb
  1. do
  2. make
  3. prepare something; get ready for something; prepare for

  1. The fifteenth letter of the Lushootseed alphabet, pronounced as a non-low front unrounded vowel.

character
  1. The seventeenth letter of the Lushootseed alphabet, pronounced as a voiceless velar stop.

character
  1. The nineteenth letter of the Lushootseed alphabet, pronounced as a voiceless labialized velar stop.

verb
  1. take, get, hold, grasp; carry in the hand.

verb
  1. (transitive form) to pick up something, to have something, grab something or someone, take something

character
  1. The eighteenth letter of the Lushootseed alphabet, pronounced as a voiceless ejective velar stop.

character
  1. The twentieth letter of the Lushootseed alphabet, pronounced as a voiceless labialized ejective velar stop.

verb
  1. to ride

  3. (of salmon) to travel upstream

noun

name

noun

noun
